result.execSummary:
The defendant Teangelo Sincere Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
Cognitive intervention programming.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

No contact with the victim's family.
No firearms; weapons.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

Restitution payable to Stephanie Carson and Ralph Cuibela for $8,424.00 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Payable first and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.  Bail to be applied if applicable.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.
The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Teangelo Sincere Taylor

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Teangelo Sincere Taylor in court, in custody with Attorney Angel L Johnson.  Attorney Ian Vance Curzan for Chad Wozniak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  
Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statements by: Kellie C.arson, Stephanie Carson, Ralph J. Cuibela, Isiah Carson, Sheryl Taylor, Tammy King and Charees Harris.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 30 YEARS, with credit for 250 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 20 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* No contact with the victim's family.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Restitution payable to Stephanie Carson and Ralph Cuibela for $8,424.00 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Payable first and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  

Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Sentencing Letters from Defendant's family, received and filed.
Sentencing Memorandum, received and filed.

Defendant Teangelo Sincere Taylor in court with attorney Angel Johnson and Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Teangelo Sincere Taylor in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waived constitutional rights, changed plea to Guilty and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered judgment of conviction entered into the record.  Defense to submit a sentencing memo.  Court did not order Pre-Sentence Investigation.  Court ordered case adjourned for Sentence Hearing in Branch 6.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Addendum, Jury instructions and Ineligible Voting Notice, received and filed.

Defendant Teangelo Sincere Taylor in court with Attorney Angela L. Johnson.  Defendant Teangelo Sincere Taylor in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Plea hearing.  Defense request an adjournment for reasons stated in the motion.  The court grants defense request and order the matter adjourned to branch 15.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04B (Amended), parties are hereby advised: Effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.


  Plea hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Request for Adjournment of Plea Hearing received and filed.

Defendant Teangelo Sincere Taylor in court with Attorney Haley E Wentz and Attorney Angel Johnson.  Defendant Teangelo Sincere Taylor in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm for Jennifer Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea hearing.  Defense has received new discovery from the State and the parties are still in negotiations.  Defense is requesting a new plea hearing.  The court will grant defense request and order the matter adjourned to Branch 15.
  Plea hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Teangelo Sincere Taylor in court with attorney Haley E Wentz and attorney Angel L. Johnson.  Defendant Teangelo Sincere Taylor in custody.  
Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 15.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Teangelo Sincere Taylor in court with attorney Ariel Rosenberg on the behalf of Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Teangelo Sincere Taylor in custody. Teangelo Sincere Taylor appeared by video means 
Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Case in court for scheduling conference. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer. Defense requests brief adjournment conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Rothstein.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.

Defendant Teangelo Sincere Taylor in court by video with Attorney Angel L Johnson who appears in person.  Defendant Teangelo Sincere Taylor in custody.  Jennifer Tate appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Sullivan. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/42b75bd2-aff2-36d8-c51b-589000f427b0  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Teangelo Sincere Taylor
Current: 2611 W Orchard St, Milwaukee, WI 53205   (Effective: 01-19-2022)
Prior: 5545 North 66th Street, #317, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Defendant Teangelo Sincere Taylor in court with attorney Paige Aleece Styler.  Defendant Teangelo Sincere Taylor in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Teangelo Sincere Taylor appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
